titles: Fancies favourite: or, The mirror of the times. Being a young ladies commendation of a young gallant, which hath a long time shewed her much love; which by his civil carriage, and long patience in waiting on her, at last conquered her, who was once resolved to lead a single life, and therefore he termed her the Phoenix of the times. To the tune of, Francis Phoenix.
author: C. H.
publisher: Printed for F[rancis]. Coles, T[homas]. Veres [sic], J[ohn]. Wright, and J[ohn] Clarke.,
notes: Verse: "Come, come, away you maidens fair ..."
Place, date of publication, and publisher's names from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
